title: Error - Could not connect to DB
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `2022.99.99-dev-60b5a9ef`

OS & Version: `Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS`

Commit hash : `sha256:d4b9a2121592e5bb4e54ab16d6411138efe33bb4b8ccf571a4e12bafaacc04c4`

#### Actual behaviour
This issue began to occur after pulling the latest devel image using ``docker-compose pull`` 

#### Backtrace

````
rpcdaemon_1  | [INFO] [06-30|13:01:25.773] DB schemas compatible                    reader=6.0.0 database=6.0.0
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:01:25.775] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: MDBX_PANIC: Likely because hardware failure. Before creating issue please use tools like https://www.memtest86.com to test RAM and tools like https://www.smartmontools.org to test Disk. To handle hardware risks: use ECC RAM, use RAID of disks, run multiple application instances (or do backups). If hardware checks passed - check FS settings - 'fsync' and 'flock' must be enabled.  Otherwise - please create issue in Application repo. On default DURABLE mode, power outage can't cause this error. On other modes - power outage may break last transaction and mdbx_chk can recover db in this case, see '-t' and '-0|1|2' options., label: consensus, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:268 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:01:28.683] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:01:33.145] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:01:40.813] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:01:54.859] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:02:21.765] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:03:14.216] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
rpcdaemon_1  | [EROR] [06-30|13:04:15.693] Could not connect to DB                  err="mdbx_env_open: resource temporarily unavailable, label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:252 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|13:01:17.273] Build info                               git_branch=devel git_tag=v2021.10.03-1379-g60b5a9efe-dirty git_commit=60b5a9efe3db324f4060fbdbdb841959d6d8f7c3
````

Have you tried the suggestion ?

Likely because hardware failure. 
Before creating issue please use tools like https://www.memtest86.com to test RAM and tools like https://www.smartmontools.org to test Disk. To handle hardware risks: use ECC RAM, use RAID of disks, run multiple application instances (or do backups). If hardware checks passed - check FS settings - 'fsync' and 'flock' must be enabled.  Otherwise - please create issue in Application repo. On default DURABLE mode, power outage can't cause this error. On other modes - power outage may break last transaction and mdbx_chk can recover db in this case, see '-t' and '-0|1|2' options., label: consensus, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:245 config.go:268 main.go:19 command.go:856 command.go:974 command.go:902 command.go:895 main.go:38 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"

ü§î
 I have other chain nodes running on the same hardware running just fine. Only the two erigon nodes are down with the same error.

Other chain nodes ... probably their node implementation do not use MDBX.
Please try the suggestion.

It seems like the issue was permission related on the chaindata folder. Changed the permission on the directory and it is no longer crashing. Now the node is stuck on `block=15050001`

```
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:10.143] Generating ethash verification cache     epoch=502 percentage=84 elapsed=3.001s
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:23.613] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=15050670 blk/second=33.500 alloc=2.1GB sys=3.6GB
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:43.613] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=15051837 blk/second=58.350 alloc=2.1GB sys=3.6GB
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:44.855] [1/16 Headers] Processed                 highest inserted=15051838 age=40s
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:45.383] [4/16 Bodies] Processing bodies...       from=15050000 to=15051838
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:57.844] [4/16 Bodies] Processed                  highest=15051838
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:35:57.845] [5/16 Senders] Started                   from=15050000 to=15051838
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:36:00.009] [6/16 Execution] Blocks execution        from=15050000 to=15051838
erigon_1     | [WARN] [06-30|18:36:00.040] [6/16 Execution] Execution failed        block=15050001 hash=0xf7de68e7dc7fe5861326c1f71b21556a2eaffbe273f504b94f33b448bc250e14 err="could not apply tx 3 from block 15050001 [0xd4a69f91392d680410c2aedf88e806de292dfa2c5f6f1fe60a1a3630892e6f97]: nonce too low: address 0x67F2BA3Cf6bD017B9CeBA75751bdb4b22e1c1914, tx: 1 state: 2"
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:36:00.040] UnwindTo                                 block=15050000 bad_block_hash=0xf7de68e7dc7fe5861326c1f71b21556a2eaffbe273f504b94f33b448bc250e14
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:36:00.040] [6/16 Execution] Completed on            block=15050000
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|18:36:31.436] [14/16 TxLookup] ETL [1/2] Extracting    from=CanonicalHeader block=14517263 alloc=2.8GB sys=4.8GB
```
My guess is that if your chain is stuck on block 15050001 you haven't upgrade to include the Grey Glacier hard fork. Pull the latest version of Erigon and re-build and it should correct itself.

I upgraded to the latest devel docker image already. 

I think I may need to do this ‚û°Ô∏è [https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4268](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/4268)

I just realized there was an update pushed about an hour ago for `devel` in docker hub but it still didn't work. 
```
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:35:36.277] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 1, Homestead: 1150000, DAO: 1920000, DAO Support: true, Tangerine Whistle: 2463000, Spurious Dragon: 2675000, Byzantium: 4370000, Constantinople: 7280000, Petersburg: 7280000, Istanbul: 9069000, Muir Glacier: 9200000, Berlin: 12244000, London: 12965000, Arrow Glacier: 13773000, Gray Glacier: 15050000, Terminal Total Difficulty: <nil>, Engine: ethash}" genesis=0xd4e56740f876aef8c010b86a40d5f56745a118d0906a34e69aec8c0db1cb8fa3
```

```
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:46:45.455] [1/16 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=15050000 blk/second=0.000 alloc=3.3GB sys=6.5GB
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:46:45.455] Req/resp stats                           req=39 reqMin=15049999 reqMax=15052148 skel=15 skelMin=15051536 skelMax=15346256 resp=61 respMin=15050000 respMax=15052149 dups=179
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:46:45.455] Queue sizes                              anchors=2 links=1730 persisted=63426
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:46:45.455] {15050192-15051536 links=1345 (15050192-15051536)} => 3394a4b7759fc8f5ad597ded61e9ca7a65024f88fbf634a6976d642991289d04, anchorQueue.idx=1, next retry in 4.903356849s 
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:46:45.455] {15051765-15052149 links=385 (15051765-15052149)} => 12057797d748bf08c9afcf634c6ee3c36f32de4893144d8fcc08ffd38bdf623c, anchorQueue.idx=0, next retry in 3.419695787s 
erigon_1     | [INFO] [06-30|19:46:45.879] [snapshots] Dumping txs                  block num=14513569 alloc=3.3GB sys=6.5GB```
Any update on how to fix this issue? I can't be the only one who failed to upgrade in time and is stuck on this block.

15050000 it's https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/06/16/gray-glacier-announcement/
try update erigon version

> 15050000 it's https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/06/16/gray-glacier-announcement/ try update erigon version

I am running ``erigon version 2022.99.99-dev-fff6e4ff``
Can you please confirm if that is the version I am supposed to be running
must be ok. restart erigon and show more logs here.

please let know if you need more

```
